item.title: Real Agency
item.description: I nominate agency as Word of the Year for 2025. I don‚Äôt nominate agentic, which is suddenly hot shit: See, agency is a noun, and agentic is an adjective. And, as Strunk and White taught us, Write with nouns and verbs, not with adjectives and adverbs‚Ä¶ it is nouns and verbs, not their assistants, that [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Not all AI-assisted programming is vibe coding (but vibe coding rocks)
item.description: Vibe coding is having a moment. The term was coined by Andrej Karpathy just a few weeks ago (on February 6th) and has since been featured in the New York Times, Ars Technica, the Guardian and countless online discussions. item.description:

He presents compelling, detailed arguments for both ends of the spectrum - his key message is that it's best to maintain very wide error bars for what might happen next:

item.title: TIL: Styling an HTML dialog modal to take the full height of the viewport
item.description: TIL: Styling an HTML dialog modal to take the full height of the viewport I spent some time today trying to figure out how to have a modal <dialog> element present as a full height side panel that animates in from the side. The full height bit was hard, until Natalie helped me figure out that browsers apply a default max-height: calc(100% - 6px - 2em); rule which needs to be over-ridden.
